description: On 24 July, Taoiseach Micheál Martin and Minister for Education Norma Foley announced that the plan, worth €375m (£342m) and will fund an additional 1,000 post-primary teachers. The money will fund the building of new school premises to allow for social distancing and 120 extra counselling posts to help students adjust to a different educational environment. A €75m (£68.5m) building package will be used to alter buildings and classrooms. The first four years of primary school would not need to social distance, but beyond that age there would be a one-metre distance between pupils.
